author: Not available
source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry

text.0: Miserere mei, deus, secundam magnam misericordiam tuam.
text.1: Mildsa me, mihtig drihten,           swa ðu manegum dydest,
text.3: Auerte faciem tuam a peccatis meis, et omnes iniquitates meas dele.
text.4: Awend þine ansyne           a fram minum
text.5: fræcnum fyrenum,           and nu forð heonon
text.6: eall min unriht adwæsc           æghwær symle.
text.7: Cor mundum crea in me, deus, et spiritum rectum innoua in uisceribus meis.
text.8: Syle me, halig god,           heortan clæne,
text.11: Ne proicias me a facie tua, et spiritum sanctum tuum ne auferas a me.
text.12: Ne awyrp þu me,           wuldres ealdor,
text.13: fram ðinre ansyne           æfre to feore,
text.14: ne huru on weg aber           þone halgan gast,
text.15: þæt he me færinga           fremde wyrðe.
text.16: Redde michi lætitiam salutaris tui, et spiritu principali confirma me.
text.17: Syle me þinre hælu           holde blisse,
